intro: Rosularia borissovae, commonly known as the Borissov's roseleaf, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its compact, rosette-forming growth habit. The plant produces small, delicate flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming in early summer. Rosularia borissovae thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and requires a cool, arid climate to flourish. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
